body.p:
Pittsburg Landing April 14th/62
Mrs Geo. W. Johnson. Dear Madam
One Thursday afternoon at 2 Clock of the day succeeding the great Battle at this place I recognized the body of your Husband G. W. Johnson badly wounded.
He was found by Genl McCook Genl Nelson Ordered him to be sent on board the boat, where he was Kindly attended to by the surgical department and a chaplain of an Iowa Regiment-
As far as my duties would permit it being 9 Ock Wednesday Morning I visited him at the boat to render him every assistance in my power-
I found him dead. He left many messages for Genl Breckenridge and yourself which you will find inclosed-
I also send a lock of his hair and will send his body if possible. I have had him packed in a rough box with salt. It was the best I could do. The Chaplain was as attentive to him as a man could be

Very Respfully J. S. Jackson
Comm 3rd Ky Cavalry
